Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Detonation: A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated a pack at a customs area in Maiduguri, killing or injuring only herself.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill three and injure others in Ikorodu.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 15 hunters were beheaded by Boko Haram in Gubio LGA.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 2 January, a military vehicle was hit by a landmine planted by Boko Haram in Igawa, Mayo Sava. One soldier dead and two wounded.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 3 January, Boko Haram fighters attacked Glem, Dabanga: one civilian wounded by gunfire, some food were seized.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Looting: On 3 January, Boko Haram fighters attacked Kalguiwa, Mora: two herds seized.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 4 January, a Boko Haram incursion in Sandawadjiri, Mayo Sava, was repelled by local militia.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 6 January, Boko Haram fighters attacked Ngourou and were repelled by Cameroonian soldiers.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Looting: On 8 January, the villages of Mbanari and Bia around Kolofata were looted and several herds were seized by Boko Haram fighters.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Four persons, including two Boko Haram suicide bombers died in a suicide attack at Kaleri area of Gwange in Maiduguri.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: A 19-year-old student was killed in Angwa Umadi Village in Shiroro local government area of the state Saturday night by suspected cattle rustlers - identity not known.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa)
Summary: On 9 January 2017, 20 African coalition soldiers were killed in an attack by IS West Africa soldiers on their positions in the town of Buni Yadi.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa)
Summary: On 11 January 2017, 13 Nigerian soldiers were killed and others injured in an attack by IS West Africa militants in the town of Anjini in Borno.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 11 January, a 70-years-old man was killed by Boko Haram men in Afade, Makari.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Three suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers target a checkpoint at the entrance of Madagali. Nine dead (plus bombers), 13 hospitalised. Possible new tactic to avoid detection: One of the bombers carried a baby.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Two members of Boko Haram kidnap and kill a young boy after he identified them to authorities.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 16 bodies were found in the Gnam-Gnam area. They are suspected to have been killed by Boko Haram.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: At least 11 members of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) were killed at Abaji area of Kastina Ala local government area of Benue State. Daily Trust gathered from locals in the affected area that the CJTF members were holding a meeting at Tse-Igber village in Abaji community when some gun-wielding youths who rode on a Bajaj motorcycle opened fire on them. It is not clear if the members of CJTF were armed at the time of the attack.

Perpetrator: Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Six dead after suspected Boko Haram detonate two suicide explosives, first at a mosque, then second at the University of Maiduguri. Among the dead include a lecturer. Abubakar Shekau later formally declared responsibility.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: The Chairman of Sokoto State Chapter of the Medical and Health Workers Union of Nigeria is kidnapped on 16/01.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Three people were reported killed and scores injured after unidentified gunmen attacked a "relaxation spot" in Zango-Kataf LGA.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Property destruction: A pipeline belonging to the Niger Petroleum Development Company, NPDC, is set on fire by suspected "oil rebels."

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 18 January, 2 children were hit by a landmine in Soueram, Fotokol. 2 wounded.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram abducts two young boys in Maiduguri, killing one three days later after their father could not pay them they money they demanded.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: On 18 January 2017, the coordinator of Roll Back Malaria in Kogi state, his driver and 3 others were killed by gunmen on their way from an advocacy campaign in Ajaokuta. Date not clear.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Gunmen kill a community leader and his Togolese companion in Ijegun. Date not clear.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Members of Kogi State Ministry of Health are attacked by unidentified gunmen. One death reported.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: At least 3 people were killed and 4 others injured in a suicide attack by a suspected Boko Haram member in the Madana district of the city of Kousseri.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 20 January, the incursion of 15 Boko Haram men was repelled in Korgui, Mora by Cameroonian soldiers.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified gunmen attack and kill five in Ajaokuta. A similar attack against state government officials occurred in the area two days earlier.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 21 January, Boko Haram men could hoist 2 BH flags in Kolofata during an incursion. Cameroonian soldiers brought them down after confronting them.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Many Boko Haram fighters were killed () by Nigerien air strikes as they attempted to retreat through the marshes near Lake Chad after they attacked a military base at Geskerou in the Diffa region.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 2 Nigerien soldiers were killed and 7 others wounded in an attack by a large number of Boko Haram fighters on a military base in Geskerou in the Diffa region. 3 army vehicles were also torched.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 22 January, Boko Haram men attacked Blakafe, Mora: one person was wounded by gunfire and some food was seized.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: One killed and others injured in an attack on a Fulani area on Zankan. Perpetrators not identified.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified persons kill a Fulani and injure others in Riyom area.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members abducted about seven women and killed three other persons when they attacked Ndagu Village of Askira-Uba Local Government Area of Borno State.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unknown assailants abduct and kill a man in Ipaja.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified persons have reportedly executed the village head and youth leader of Ikot Anta Enen Obom village, Ukanafun Local Government Area, Akwa Ibom State on 24/01.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Looting: On 25 January, some armed men (assumed ISWAP/Boko Haram) seized people's goods at the mosque's exit in Bia, Kolofata.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Two Boko Haram suicide bombers target Maiduguri during the early morning hours - one at 2am, and the other at 5. Only fatalities reported were that of the bombers. Two other injures.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified gunmen attack Magazu village on motorcycles, kill one person.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Looting: On 27 January, 16 Boko Haram men seized some cloth, food and cattle in Gabal, Kolofata.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: An All progressive Congress (APC) party chieftain, Emmanuel Obuozo was assassinated in his residence in Osomini by gunmen believed to be hired assassins. It is believed the assassination is connected to the political wrangling in the state.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Suspected assassins have killed the village head of Ikot Anta Eneng Obom in Ukanafun Local Government Area of Akwa Ibom State.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: More than 20 people were feared dead after Boko Haram gunmen opened fire on a convoy of motorists travelling under military escort between Maiduguri and Damboa at Korowaso forest. No reported exchange of fire between military and Boko Haram.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Looting: On 29 January, Boko Haram men attacked Kerawa (assumed to have looted). No further info available.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: An aid to the governor is shot and killed by unknown perpetrators.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: The body of a man with marks of violence on his body was found in an abandoned well. It could have being that he was either killed and his corpse dumped inside the well by his attackers or he fell into the well out of desperation to escape a mob action.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: An 8 year-old female suicide bomber was on 30/01 detonated and killed while trying to gain access to an internally displaced persons (IDP) camp in Banki town in Borno state. No other casualty reported.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 1 person was killed and 3 wounded in an attack by Boko Haram fighters on the Ouro-Moussa Kambo locality of Fotokol district.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: An armed group attacked a UN Technical Monitoring Team, killing five individuals a UN independent contractor, three Nigerian nationals and one Cameroonian national in the vicinity of Hosere Jongbi, near Kontcha, Cameroon, about 700 kilometres north of the capital Yaounde. A soldier of the Rapid Intervention Battalion belonging to the escort of the team was also wounded.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: At least 4 people were killed, including 3 bombers, in a suspected Boko Haram suicide attack at Double market in the Far North near the Nigerian border. Other sources estimated as many as 16 had died. Many of those injured were taken to Mora hospital.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram suicide bombers attack a Maiduguri mosque. One person was killed from the explosion apart from the suicide bomber. The bomber was belied to be between 8-10 years of age.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified gunmen killed a UN official, 3 Nigerians, 1 Cameroonian while in the process of demarcating and delineating the Nigeria-Cameroon border in line with the judgment of the International Court of Justice.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 3 February, two women Boko Haram suicide bombers attempted to launch a suicidal attack in Kerawa: one exploded herself under the pressure of militia and the second was killed by the militia.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Property destruction: On 4 February, Boko Haram men attacked Goumouldi, as a retaliation against cattle dealers. 4 houses were burned down.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Two people were killed by Boko Haram during an invasion on Sasawa, Damaturu. The perpetrators had earlier on attacked a military base before raiding the community where the victims were killed.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 6 Cameroonian soldiers were injured in a clash with Boko Haram fighters at Gakara.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Looting: On 7 February, Boko Haram soldiers attacked Bakaresse, Kolofata: mobile phones, money, cloth and food were seized.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Youths suspected to be pipeline vandals invaded Korokorosei Community, is the village of the Speaker of the Bayelsa State House of Assembly in Southern Ijaw Local Government Area of the state, killing one and injuring others.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: A man was killed by Boko Haram fighters during an attack on Chibok. A 5-year-old boy was abducted during the raid. Another source reported that the victim was an Islamic scholar.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: A senior lecturer with the Taraba State Polytechnic was killed by kidnappers who abducted him with a second lecturer in the night. It was reported that the kidnappers, who were 8 in number, stormed the lecturers' quarter and seized the duo.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Some gunmen, in the early hours of 10/02, attacked a police station at Eika community in Okehi Local Government Area of Kogi State, killing two policemen and a detainee. The gunmen also attacked the residence of the chairman of the community, Mallam Sadiq Obomi and shot him dead.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attacked Mussa village, destroying houses. Causalities not known.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: A man was killed by unidentified gunmen. The victim was hacked to death with a machete by 2 young boys after he was stopped while riding on a motorcycle. The reasons for the attack are not known.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: A Monarch (Chief EWmmanuel Umahaeyo) and a youth leader (Comrade Esit-Ime Emmanson) were assassinated by gunmen for challenging a youth faction that hijacked the management and control of the community revenue from an oil palm plantation. The date of the incident was not given.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attack Mifa, Chibok LGA killing an Islamic scholar and breaking the hands of an unnamed boy. Soldiers stationed in Chibok were quickly drafted and we're able to repel the attack killing one of the attackers.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified gunmen clad in military camouflage struck at a farm at Igbodu area of Epe, Lagos State, abducting seven persons. The victims are two private guards, said to be members of the Oodua People's Congress, OPC, and five farm workers at Eliasa Farm.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 3 Cameroonian soldiers were killed when their vehicle hit a mine planted by suspected Boko Haram fighters at Gouzda Vreket in Mayo-Tsanaga.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 17 February 2017, scores of Boko Haram (ISWAP) and locals lost their lives in an attack by heavily armed fighters as they attempted to storm Maiduguri through its border with Mafa. It is not clear if military forces were involved.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 17 February, 12 Boko Haram men attacked Doudo, Bogo: 4 motos and other goods seized. They were caught by Cameroonian soldiers. 4 dead.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attacked Yaza-Kumaza village at about 4 p.m. on 19/02, killing three.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram insurgents attacked Yaza-Kumaza village and killed no fewer than 4 persons.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Ten members of the APC are injured when they were attacked by "thugs" during a party meeting.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 21 February, Boko Haram forces were repelled from Ganse, Kolofata by Cameroonian soldiers.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 3 soldiers were killed in the Diffa area in an attack by suspected Boko Haram fighters.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
Summary: At least 16 soldiers were killed, including one officer, as many as 19 wounded, seven vehicles stolen, and four more burned by suspected Islamist fighters in an attack near Tilwa in the Ouallam area, near Mangaize. Other reports said at least 15 soldiers had been killed. An IS linked group led by Abou El Walid El Sahraou is believed to have carried out the attack.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 2 people were killed (including a bomber) and 2 wounded in a suicide attack by suspected Boko Haram militants in Amchide.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: A lecturer with College of Education, Katsina Ala and a All Progressive Congress (APC) ward chairman were killed by unknown assailants. The ward chairman was linked to a kidnap gang.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified gunmen abduct two German archaeologists and kill two hunters in Janjela village, reasons not known. Source published on 22/02, exact date of attack not known. The Germans were later freed.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 24 February, Boko Haram fighters attacked Kouyape, Mayo Sava. One local militia member was killed, three shops were raided and motos seized.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: A villager was killed by Boko Haram fighters in the Waza area.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: A group of 50, identified only as "political thugs" attack and kidnapped an election worker in suburban Owerri, at Ulakwo. Many of the group was later arrested. The victims sustained injuries.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: A villager was killed in the Madina neighbourhood of Fotokol by Boko Haram fighters.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Three gunmen suspected to be assassins have killed the Chief Imam of Egbeta Mosque, in Ovia North East Local Government Area of Edo State on 04/03.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 2 suspected BK suicide bombers were killed by soldiers in the Boudoua area of Limani.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa)
Summary: On or around 7 March 2017, IS West Africa militants attacked and killed 4 soldiers of the Nigerian army and captured one soldier during clashes near Lake Chad in Borno.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: A suspected BK suicide bomber detonated himself in the Magdeme area. No casualties were reported.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 10 March, 11 Boko Haram men attacked Goumouzini. One dead, one wounded and 18 houses burned down.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: One person was killed and several wounded in an attack by Boko Haram on Goulouzivini village, near Wana.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Two Fulani civilians are killed by unknown perpetrators at Unguwan Luka, Jemma LGA. Another in Zangon Kataf LGA.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 12 March, Boko Haram fighters attacked a military post in Soueram, Fotokol. 3 BH killed and 2 soldiers wounded.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram releases a video of the execution of three accused of spying. Location (likely in Sambisa Forest or outer Borno State), date of the execution not known.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Five persons were on the night of 15/03 killed after some armed men invaded some settlements in Mbayongo District of Katsina-Ala Local Council area. It was gathered that three of the persons killed were from Nagu settlement, one at Tse Gyudu and another at Tse Weryina.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Four female suicide bombers at about early morning of Wednesday detonated explosive devices at Usmanti along Muna Garage axis, Maiduguri. Two men were killed as a result to the explosion while about 16 injured people were administered with the first aid. Perpetrators not identified. Premium Times claims six dead.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: A day following the attacks in Katsina-Ala, five are killed in Ukum LGA. It is not known if the perpetrators were the same as those in Katsina-Ala.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: A traditional monarch is shot and wounded in Isoko South LGA "at the weekend." Perpetrators not known.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: A group of three suicide bombers strike outside a mosque in Ummarari, Jere LGA. The blast killed a mother, her two children and a member of the Civilian JTF. Eight others injured. Perpetrators not known. In a conflicting reported, Leadership (Abuja), reports that attack occurred in Maiduguri proper, along Damboa road.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill 17 in a Zaki Biam market. Others reported injured. An 18th death occurred the following day in a separate attack.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill 17 in a Zaki Biam market. Others reported injured. An 18th death occurred the following day in a separate attack.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Series of suicide bomb blasts near an IDP camp have occurred in 3 locations around Muna Garage area of Maiduguri during the early morning hours, killing five bombers and three civilians. Other injuries reported. The following day Vanguard updated the fatality count to 20.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Looting: Boko Haram raided Sabon Garin Kimba on 24/03, stealing food and medical supplies. No human injury reported.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Suspected Boko Haram fighters stormed Kalari Abdiye village, near Konduga killing three people on suspicion of collaborating with the military.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Suspected Boko Haram members attacked communities of Kalari, Mittiri, Akalli and Arribbari in Konduga Local Government Area of Borno State kidnapping 10 people. The source reports all 10 were abducted from Kalari.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attack Pulka village on 30/03. The attackers abducted 18 girls.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attackers killed a civilian who had tried to escape after refusing to pay protection money in Dumba, near the Lake Chad area. Following the attack the perpetrators abducted four women and took a number of cattle.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 30 March, two Boko Haram suicide bombers died in Kourgui, Mayo Sava in the explosion of their charges.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified gunmen kill a young boy, while injuring his father and mother, reasons not known.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 31 March, Boko Haram fighters attacked Gakara, Mayo Sava: one civilian wounded, 7 bicycles and 6 sheep seized.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Three suicide bombers detonate in the Muna garage and Dusuman areas of the city. The first two, in Muna Garage detonated without injuring any potential targets, and the second, in Dusuman caused one injury.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 2 suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers set off their explosives at the entrance to Mora, near a technical high school. No other casualties were reported.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: A suicide bomber attempts an attack on a wedding party in Belbelo community of Jere LGA before he was stopped by a guest's dog, who pounced on the assailant as the explosive detonated. Only the bomber reported dead. The bomber's identity not given by the source.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa)
Summary: Boko Haram releases a video of propaganda against its Barnawi Faction (coded as ISWAP), as well of footage of the group flogging a group of villagers. Location, date not known.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 05/04 scores of Boko Haram fighters rode on motorcycles into Abbati (Abari), a farming community outside Maiduguri, where they killed seven civilians and stole 360 heads of livestock.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 6 April, Boko Haram men attacked Gakara: one woman was raped, CNI and cloth seized.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attackers abducted 13 women at Hambagda, near the Cameroon border.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: At least 4 people were killed by Boko Haram fighters in an attack on the locality of Ganei.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: A suicide bombing by a suspected Boko Haram bomber resulted in 3 killed and 20 wounded in Kolofata.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram killed eight loggers at Kayamla village, near Dolori.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Twin female suicide bombers were on the morning of 08/04 killed when Improvised Explosive Devices, IEDs strapped on their bodies exploded near a targeted mosque in Juddumuri village of Polo General Area of Maiduguri. Also five people were confirmed to have sustained various degree of injuries in the attack. No group has yet claimed responsibility for the attack.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: At least 2 people were killed by Boko Haram fighters during an attack in Sandawadjiri.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified gunmen abducted the Cross Rivers Commissioner for Water Resources at Effionawan Street in Mayne Avenue area of Calabar South.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Two Boko Haram suicide bombers are dead following a failed attempt on the University of Maiduguri. It is believed the explosive detonations were premature. Boko Haram had unsuccessfully tried enter the school grounds the day before.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unknown armed men invaded Abaji Market in Katsina-Ala Local Government Area of Benue State, killing four persons and leaving scores with various degrees of injuries.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Gunmen attempt assassination of an APC Senator in Aiyetoro. Injuries not known.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: The traditional ruler for Akoko South West is kidnapped by unknown persons on 15/04.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: A journalist is killed in Yenagoa by suspected hired assassins on 16/04, reasons unknown.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Four unidentified gunmen have killed the newly sworn-in Ukanafun Local Government Council Secretary on a farm.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 18 April 2017, an explosive device believed to have been planted by Boko Haram exploded near a bridge at Wulle village, Gujba Local Government Area of Yobe State, killing one and injuring seven other members of a unidentified local armed group .

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 19 April, Boko Haram men attacked Mbichere, Mayo Sava: 1 dead, 3 girls kidnapped.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Suspected Boko Haram fighters killed one person and abducted 3 girls in Mbereche, near Limani.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: A Boko Haram suicide bomber on a bicycle killed a constable and 2 civilians in an attack in Kolofata. 4 others were injured.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified gunmen assassinated a journalist at his home in Yenagoa.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 3 Cameroonian soldiers were killed and 5 wounded when their truck hit a landmine planted by suspected Boko Haram militants as it passed between Homeka and Bladole in Mora district.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: An unidentified suicide bomber, targeting travellers, attacks Shuwari village, about 10 km away from Maiduguri. Only the bomber reported dead.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Hiding explosives in a wheelbarrow, two unidentified suicide bombers kill themselves and four villagers.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: One civilian was killed and 35 other injured, as well as 7 BIR soldiers, during an attack by Boko Haram militants on Ndaba in the Kolofata area. Several militants were also killed (unknown fatalities coded as 10).

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS

Perpetrator identity not reported. Among the dead was a member of the Civilian JTF, though it is unclear if the militia member was a specific target.

Summary: A suicide bombing was reported in the Chakarmari area. The bomber was killed and one civilian was injured.

The attack does not seem to have been pre-meditated. The weakened jihadists have been forced to constantly move around for several weeks on the shores of Lake Chad in search for food from residents, but also to escape from regular patrols by the army that are criss-crossing the area

Another 18 were wounded in the fighting with the militant group on five islands near the border with Nigeria, the Chadian army confirmed. The army claimed their troops had killed 162 Boko Haram fighters and destroyed six vehicles along with many of the motorcycles often used by Boko Haram fighters in their raids. In contrast, Boko Haram says they killed 74 Chadians in attacks.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Two Boko Haram suicide bombers attempt to gain entry into a Maiduguri hospital before they and stopped by two barking dogs near the gate of the building. Only the bombers themselves reported dead from the blast.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: A suicide bombing attributed to Boko Haram in Ouro Kessoum, Mayo-Sava in Extreme Nord, left at least nine killed, including the suicide bomber, and four injured.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attacks a group of fishermen at Guguri and Dabar Wanzam villages "last weekend" (source dated 09/07), killing 31. The attackers allowed one of the fishermen to survive, sending him to Baga to tell locals in the area what had happened.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unknown gunmen on 05/08 shot dead a yet-to-be identified middle-age woman in Osogbo. The incident occurred at about 9.00 am at Old Garage area of Osogbo. The reasons for the attack are not known.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: A man in his mid-forties is killed by unknown gunmen that invaded Atongo village in Katsina/Ala Local Government Area of Benue State.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 6 August, a suicidal attack by 2 kamikazes in Waza, Logone et Chari, wounded 13 civilians.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 6 August, a suicidal attack in Amchide, Mayo Sava, killed 9 children and wounded 4.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unknown gunmen with unknown motive invaded St. Philips Catholic Church located in Umuezekwe, Ofufe-Amakwa, Ozubulu community in Ekwusigo Local Government Area of Anambra State and opened fire on the worshippers during the morning services. 47 reported dead, many others injured. The attackers may have been members of a drug cartel.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Numbering 10, "cultists" attack the palace of the village head of Abak Obong village in Etim Ekpo local council. Two dead, others injured.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: The Village Head of Bijeje is killed by unknown gunmen. Several suspects were later arrested.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified attackers ambushed a commercial bus in Elibrada in Emohua LGA and abducted 15 passengers. It is noted by the source the area is an oil hub.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram elements abducted two people at Madakar village, Mayo Moskota: one was found dead on 13/08/2017 in Goledje

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: "Many" dead and 60 houses destroyed following a Boko Haram attack on Ghumbili in Madagali LGA. The attack lasted from 11 p.m. on Wednesday to 3 a.m. on Thursday.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: "Many" dead and 60 houses destroyed following a Boko Haram attack on Ghumbili in Madagali LGA. The attack lasted from 11 p.m. on Wednesday to 3 a.m. on Thursday.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: No fewer than four persons were killed in an attack by Boko Haram insurgents at Wanori-Amarwa community of Konduga local government area of Borno. The News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) reports that the incident occurred on Saturday at about 11: 00 PM at a village along Maiduguri-Konduga Road.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Two tractor drivers were killed by Boko Haram insurgents in Jere Local Government Area of Borno. The attack occurred "in the last few days" (source dated 13/08).

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: The village Head of Ikot-Obot in Cross River State was reportedly killed by a group of persons suspected to be hired assassins in Bakassi Local Government Area of the state, weekend.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 13 August, Boko Haram elements attacked a herders' campement in Yegoua, Kolofata: several herds seized and several herders disappeared.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Looting: Suspected members of Boko Haram the night of 14/08 attacked two Adamawa communities, burning houses and looting foodstuffs. The communities involved were Nyibango and Muduhu, both in Madagali Local Government Area of Adamawa State. No reported loss of life.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Glo inhabitants repelled and pursued BH assailants till Dougoum (Nigeria): 3 dead and weapons seized.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: An operative of the Edo State Command of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC) was assassinated at his home in Benin by unidentified gunmen. The reason for the attack is not known.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Seven days after gunmen killed many worshippers at a Catholic Church in Ozubulu, unidentified killed a policeman and a commercial bike rider near the Assemblies of God Church in Onitsha. The two attacks may be related.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Three suicide bombers attacked a displaced persons camp at Mandarari, in Konduga, near Maiduguri, killing between 16 - 28 and wounding 82.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: BH incursion in Maskota: 1 dead, 6 children kidnapped, 4 houses burnt down, livestock slaughtered.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Forty-two farmers from Aliero town, Aliero Local Government Area of Kebbi State have reportedly been killed by Boko Haram insurgents when they travelled to Borno State for farming duties. Date and location of attacks not known. Authorities confirmed the attack on 16/08.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 3 soldiers dead and one wounded after BH ambush in Wambache in Mora.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 17 August, Boko Haram men raided Guipere, Mozogo: one dead and 6 children kidnapped, houses burned down and goods seized.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 17 August, a Cameroonian soldiers' patrol was ambushed by Boko Haram elements in Gouldouam, Mayo Sava: 3 dead and 1 wounded.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Two persons were on 18/08 killed while several others were injured following the invasion of the secretariat of the All Progressive Congress (APC) in Bayelsa State by some armed "hired thugs" to disrupt the inauguration of the new Acting Chairman of the party.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Suspected Boko Haram kidnapped six children in Biu LGA.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 19 and 20 August 2017, 40 people (39 militants and 1 solider) were killed in a military operation by Niger forces against Boko Haram in Baroua Gana area (Diffa). (fatlities divided equally across two events.)

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: An explosive device suspected to have been planted by Boko Haram militants has killed two people and injured three others along Damaturu - Biu road, Yobe State. The incident happened about 4:45pm close to Azare village.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Two livestock traders were killed and three seriously injured after triggering a mine as they fled Boko Haram along the Biu-Damaturu highway.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 19 and 20 August 2017, 40 people (39 militants and 1 solider) were killed in a military operation by Niger forces against Boko Haram in Baroua Gana area (Diffa). (fatlities divided equally across two events.)

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified gunmen killed the senior aid to Governor Samuel Ortom.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unknown gunmen were alleged to have shot and killed the former chairman of the outlawed Community Development Association, CDA, of Oghoghobi village near Benin at his residence on Sunday morning. The attack led to a violent protest among area youths.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 22 August 2017, 2 suicide bombers exploded in Amchide: 2 civilians dead and 2 vigilantes dead. 4 wounded.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: A 40-year old man was shot last night in Katchimiri (near Doulo) after an incursion of Boko Haram members.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram jihadists killed six men in Kijimatari (near Monguno) in an early morning attack. The attackers broke into the victim's homes, slitting their throats. The attack is believed to be a reprisal.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: After gunmen killed a youth chairman of the Ohoghobi community, villagers protest violently, burning the place of the local traditional ruler. A source said the villagers suspected the monarch to be the mastermind of the killing, as he had threatened him previously.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: An explosion from Boko Haram suicide bombers killed 4 people and injured 5 others in Kordo

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Suicide bombing this morning in Mozogo. No details of injuries.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attacks several villages in Guzamala LGA, killing 12 people.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attacks several villages in Nganzai LGA, killing 15 people.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Property destruction: Members of the Boko Haram sect burnt down Bayan Dutse and Kubu communities of Madagali Local Government Area of Adamawa State. The raiders also took food aid intended for Bayan Dutse. No reported loss of life or injury.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Property destruction: Members of the Boko Haram sect burnt down Bayan Dutse and Kubu communities of Madagali Local Government Area of Adamawa State. The raiders also took food aid intended for Bayan Dutse. No reported loss of life or injury.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: At least 15 people killed and 8 others abducted in Gakara (Kolofata).

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 24 August, Boko Haram men attacked Ngorsono, Logone et Chari: 4 civilians dead, 2 wounded and 20 houses burned down.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 24 August, a Boko Haram raid on Goura, Logone et Chari was repelled by local militia.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 3 dead in Zamga in an attack performed by Boko Haram

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 25 August, a Boko Haram raid on Zamga, Mozogo, was repelled by Cameroonian soldiers: 3 civilians and 2 Boko Haram men dead.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Assassins killed the Okpe PDP chairman in his residence. Three were later arrested.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Rebels burned down homes and stole vehicles and cattle after killing 16 people in two villages near Mora, in Cameroon's Far North province, about 20 kilometres (12 miles) from the border with Nigeria.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unknown gunmen have abducted eleven passengers in a bus on Ndele-Elele axis of East-West road, Emohua Local Government Area of Rivers State on the night of 28/08. The motives of the kidnapping arte not yet clear.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 30 August 2017, gunmen mounted on motorcycles (Boko Haram) attacked Ashigashia Village, burning 14 houses before they were repelled by vigilantes.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Magala Kabir village chief and one of his sons were killed in an attack.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attacks and kills 21 farmers in the Damboa region over two non-consecutive days; 17 at Bula Buba and Tawarmada villages on 31/08 and four at Mirimari village on 02/09.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram asking ransom & foodstuffs to villagers in exchange for woman abducted in Igawa.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attack an IDP camp in Banki, killing 11.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram men attempted to kidnap 4 people from Koutou village: three managed to escape, one died.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attacks and kills 21 farmers in the Damboa region over two non-consecutive days; 17 at Bula Buba and Tawarmada villages on 31/08 and four at Mirimari village on 02/09.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Gunmen attack Amatu community "at the weekend" shooting sporadically and abduction one civilian.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: A man was killed yesterday night in Doulou, near Mora by Boko Haram militants

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 3 September, Boko Haram elements raided Kalguiwa, Mayo Sava: 2 people dead.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: A child was kidnapped by Boko Haram men.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram ambush and kill four farmers in Bulamari, outside of Maiduguri.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 3 dead, 8 people kidnapped, 46 houses burned in Dzaba.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attacked Mallan village near Maiduguri on the evening of 06/09. Three reported dead. The attack was an apparent reprisal after several locals joined an area militia. Boko Haram also attacked Kesa Kura in coordination with this strike.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 17 Boko Haram fighters stormed Mallan village (near Maiduguri) at about 8:00 am (0700 GMT) on Thursday (07/09), killing two farmers. The group attack the village the previous evening as well. The attacks were an apparent reprisal after several locals joined an area militia.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified gunmen abducted 20 bus travellers in Isiokpo.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: At least seven people were killed when Boko Haram attacked an IDP camp in Ngala. The attack began with RPG fire followed by sustained gunfire.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Two suicide bombers attack Muna Garage area. The bombers were reported dead, five other injuries.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: A group of "local hunters and vigilantes" battle Boko Haram in Buni Tadi area. Two Boko Haram deaths reported, six injuries, weapons recovered and 13 hostages released. Six of the hostages were believed to be children who were abducted in Biu LGA on 19/08.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 11 September, 2 Boko Haram men clashed with unknown militia in Tallakachi, Mozogo: 1 dead.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 12 September, a military vehicle was hit by a landmine on the Wambache-Gouloudja axis: one wounded.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: "A contracted truck driver transporting UN commodities was shot by suspected Bobo-Haram fighters along the Dikwa-Maiduguri road. Despite the injury, he managed to drive to Dikwa."

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 5 dead in suicide attack by Boko Haram in Sanda-Wadjiri.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: The spouse of Meinta, farmer in Bia village, has been kidnapped last night by Boko Haram armed elements

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 14 September, Boko Haram elements ambushed some Cameroonian traders on the Bodo-Rann axis: 2 dead and 5 kidnapped.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unsubstantiated reports of "shootings and killings" throughout the city of Aba following an attack by rioters on a police station. Injuries, fatalities not numbers by source. The perpetrators may be Biafran secessionists.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 15 September 2017, MNJTF military personnel and 2 vigilantes of Bonderi were killed between Ardori and Woulba, after IED explosion.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 15 September, some Boko Haram elements attacked the Cameroonian soldiers in the Djebrili area. One soldier was wounded.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 16 September, 3 Boko Haram men attempted to kidnap a villager in Makary, Logone et Chari.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Property destruction: In the night of 16th to 17th September, Boko Haram members attacked Hidoua and Bavaloga villages, burning 109 houses.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Property destruction: On 16 September, Boko Haram elements raided Tourou, setting fire to more than 60 houses.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 5 dead in a twin suicide attack this morning in Kossa (two fatalities included for bombers).

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Suspected members of Boko Haram invaded Kurmiri village of Titiwa Ward in which the attackers killed the Chief Imam of the village alongside four other persons.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Hundreds of cars and several other valuables were destroyed at Rumuekini Community, Obio/Akpor Local Government Area of Rivers State, following the discovery of the remains of the Chairman of People Democratic Party, PDP, in Ogbogoro Ward 15. The information surrounding the death of the Ward Chair (date and perpetrators) are not known.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram suicide bombers have reportedly killed at least 15, others injured. It was gathered that the attack occurred at Mashimari, Konduga, outside Maiduguri. This Day reports the deaths of 12.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 20 September, Boko Haram elements raided Mainankoua, Mayo Sava. 2 dead and 2 wounded.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 2 wounded in Sagme attack.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram kills nine at an IDP camp in Rann on 20/09.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 2 killed people and 2 injured after Boko Haram attacked Mainankoua village (Kolofata). Many others villagers remain captives.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified gunmen on 21/09 invaded the Tsafe Command of the Federal Road Safety Corps, FRSC, in Zamfara, killing an official. Area security operatives mobilized following the attack, killing one of the perpetrators.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Explosion of a suicide bomber in Kolofata. No civilian casualties.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: The body of a soldier, possibly murdered by Boko Haram, was found this morning on the road Zamga-Djibril.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attacks Kurmiri village of Titiwa Ward, Magumeri LGA on the night of 24/09 killing an Imam and 20 others.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: On 24 September, armed men from Nigeria attacked Limani, Mayo Sava: 2 civilians wounded.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Three policemen providing security at the Ogba Zoo were shot dead by gunmen suspected to be kidnappers. The attackers abducted the director of the park. The perpetrators took the officer's weapons and fled.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 2 people seriously wounded after Boko Haram incursion in Limani

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 26 September, Boko Haram men attacked Godele, Mayo Tsanaga: 2 people kidnapped. A body was found on 16 October.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: A suicide bomber killed five people on 26/09 in a mosque in northeast Nigeria at Dikwa. Boko Haram are believed to be responsible.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 27 September, Boko Haram elements raided Doulo, Mayo Sava: one civilian wounded by gunfire.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram killed three people and set fire to 150 homes in a raid targeting rural communities in Guzamala local government area. The villages included in the attack were Goram and two neighbouring villages, Lingis and Ajidari.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 27 September, Cameroonian forces intervened and evicted Boko Haram men from Nigue, Logone et Chari.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Gunmen abducted a top Zamfara State police officer and three members of his family on a remote area of Birnin-Gwari-Funtua road on 27/09. The officer was likely not on duty at the time of attack.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Two are dead after a convoy of civilian vehicles hit a pair of landmines on the Mafa to Dikwa road in Borno state, near Koibe. There were several other injuries. Perpetrators are yet unknown.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 2 soldiers killed this morning in the explosion of a mine planted by suspected BH militants between Bonderi and Kangarwa

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 29 September, Boko Haram and militia clash in Ashigashiya, Mayo Sava: 14 houses burned down, a bike seized.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unknown gunmen attacked Gyangyang village in Jhar Chiefdom of Kanam Local Government area of Plateau state, killing the acting village head. The attack occurred during the early morning hours.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Double suicide bombing in Mozogo. 3 dead (2 kamikazes and 1 civilian) .

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 3 October, Boko Haram elements raided Fotokol, Logone et Chari: one wounded.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
Summary: Nigerien & US troops reportedly killed in ambush by presumed "ISGS" following attack on village Tongo Tongo: 4 US soldiers & 4 Nigerien soldiers killed; 2 US soldiers & 8 Nigerien soldiers wounded

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 5 October, Boko Haram elements and Cameroonian soldiers clashed in Limani.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Gunmen kidnap a magistrate near Salem University on the evening of 05/10.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Gunmen (suspected 'cultists') have killed at least two persons and injured scores, when they invaded Mgbuoshimini Community in Obio/Akpor Local Government Area of Rivers State, on the night of 05/10. It is believed the attackers targeted the town in search of rivals.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 6 October, Boko Haram men attacked Medina, Logone et Chari, but they were repelled by Cameroonian soldiers.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 9 October, Boko Haram elements raided Ldoutfa, Mayo Tsanaga, shooting on farmers: 2 dead and one wounded. 7 motos seized.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 2 civilians killed in Ldaoutsaf in an attack by Boko Haram

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified gunmen attack Mgbuosimiri during the early morning hours of 09/10, killing ten. The attacks is believed to be related to a similar attack on the town on 05/10. The Nation reports 13 dead.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified gunmen open fire on a group of Port Harcourt market traders during the early morning hours. Ten reported dead. The reason for the attack is not known. This Day reports "about 15 [dead]."

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 10 October, 2 kamikazes were discovered by Vigilante militia in Limani, Mayo Sava: one of them blew himself up, killing both.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Four Boko Haram suicide bombers are dead following a failed attempt on Umarri. At least one of the bombers targeted a mosque. No other injuries were reported. The source notes the bombers were teenage girls.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Three Boko Haram suicide bombers die in a failed attack on Dolori Hospital. No other causalities.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: A member of the People's Democratic Party (PDP) from Ogwashi-Uku community, Mr. Emeka Chimokwu, who was recently kidnapped, has been found dead. The deceased's decomposing body was discovered in a thick forest at Idumuje-Uno in Aniocha North Council Area of the state. The victim was kidnapped "last week," source dated 19/10.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Five people (plus the bomber) were killed in a suicide bomb attack when Boko Haram raided Belbelu village, near Kayamla, in the Konduga area of Borno state, at about 10:00 am (0900 GMT). The bomber was accompanied by other gunmen when fired wildly upon their attack of the village.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Four Britons are kidnapped by unidentified militants at Enukoroma community. The victims were said to have been kidnapped in the community to "protest the heavy presence of soldiers drafted from 222 Battalion for the Operation Crocodile Smiles II."

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified clan militia attacks Fulani civilians in Kajuru LGA. The date of the attack not known - likely during the month of October, though the attack could have occurred in September. Causalities likely.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified clan militia attacks Fulani civilians in Mambilla Plateau. The date of the attack not known - likely during the month of October, though the attack could have occurred in September. Causalities likely.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 17 October, an attempt by BH elements to raid a military post in Bounderi failed.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Detonation: 2 Boko Haram suicide bombers were killed in Limani in the explosion of their charges. Unclear if detonated prematurely.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Non-violent activity: Gunmen attacked a APC governorship aspirant in Erio-Ekiti. The attackers wore police uniforms, though it is not known if they were legitimate officers. No reported injuries.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 18 October 2017, a vigilante died after walking on a land-mine in Amtchali. 2 wounded.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (Greater Sahara)

They arrived in five vehicles to launch their ambush on a gendarmes base. The attackers left when Nigerien military reinforcements showed up. Updated toll: 13 dead, 5 wounded (Official Statement).

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS

Other reports indicate a third explosion occurred at an area IDP camp, injuring 10 - it is not known if the bomber was lethally injured in this instance.
