Summary: Abducted (On 30 December 2017) Taraba lawmaker Mr Hosea Ibi has died. Hosea Ibi represents Takum 1 at the state House of Assembly was found dead in Taraba State. The body was reportedly found decomposed in Takum; date of death not known.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Detonation: Unidentified persons cause an explosion in Iddo while attempting to assemble an IED. One death and two injuries reported. The causalities are believed to be of the assemblers.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 2 dead (plus the attacker) in a suicide bombing by Boko Haram at Matakaye Elie Amchide.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 1 villager was kidnapped this morning in Layouna, Waza and was found dead.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 12 are dead (plus four attackers) and 65 injured following a suicide bombing in the Muna area, outside of Maiduguri.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa)
Summary: On 18 January 2018, around 25 Nigerian soldiers were killed in an attack by IS-aligned Boko Haram militants in the village of Tamour near the Lake of Chad. Weapons and military equipments were also seized.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Five persons killed in a late night attack in Kaya Village, a suburb of Gulak town, by suspected Boko Haram members.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: A man was kidnapped in Minimari, Fotokol.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: A man was killed while at his field by Boko Haram.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Gunmen abduct Zamfara Rep's 2 children, kill 3 villagers. The Police in Zamfara have confirmed the abduction of two children of Yahaya Chado (APC), the member representing Maradun/Bakura Federal Constituency. The Police Public Relations Officer told newsmen in Gusau on Monday that the children were abducted after the gunmen invaded the lawmaker's home village at Gora in Maradun Local Government.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: No fewer than nine persons have been killed and seven children abducted by gunmen following an attack in a suburb of Iware community along Fufore/Jada road in Adamawa State. Through the gunmen were suspected to be kidnappers, it was noted by the source that Iware is a Fulani settlement. It is not known if this provided any motivating basis for the attack.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: A Boko Haram suicide bomber attacks civilians at Hyambula village in Adamawa State. Three deaths reported, including the assailant. Other injuries reported. Other Boko Haram perpetrators abducted three civilians before they fled.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa)
Summary: ISWAP attacked an outpost in the area of Chetimari, Diffa Region, killing two Nigerien national guards and a child.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Three persons were killed, several injured and property destroyed by unidentified gunmen in Jebbu-Miango community in Bassa Local Government area of the state.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram militants killed at least five loggers in Ajeri village, near the town of Dikwa.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Unidentified perpetrators "assassinate" a prominent businessman in Calabar.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 5 are killed (two of which were the bombers) and 39 injured in a Boko Haram suicide attack at Dalori IDP camp in Dalori.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: A soldier assigned to the Limani post was killed in an ambush by Boko Haram. He was going to Bonderi.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Detonation: Two Boko Haram suicide bombers attempt to attack Mandarari, in Konduga LGA, however their packs detonated early, killing only themselves.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Mr Moses Banka, a politician and businessman from Sanga Local Government Area of Kaduna State, has been assassinated by unknown gunmen. Banka was reportedly killed in (Kw)Ankwa village of Jema'a Local Government Area in Kaduna state.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 2 people killed in Yawa of Kolofata subdivision.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 6 men killed by Boko Haram in Hitawa. 100 houses, 1 church and 4 shops burned.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attacks Alau-Kofa on 04/02, kills two residents and destroys the village.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: An IED explosion wounded 7 soldiers

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: A chairman of NULGE is assassinated by unknown gunmen along Ayama Ijaw Road, Southern Ijaw LG on 09/02. The reason for the attack is not known.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 1 Boko Haram militant killed by the army, the other died when his charge exploded.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Five heavily-armed gunmen have reportedly kidnapped a chieftain of Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, Musa Saya-Saya in Kaduna State. The gunmen reportedly stormed his residence at Saya-Saya village in Ikara Local Government Area of the state around 10a.m.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On February 16, presumed Boko Haram militants abducted three civilians in Malam Boulamari. They escaped on 1 March.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: No fewer than 22 persons (plus three bombers) were killed and 28 others injured in a multiple suicide bombing at a market in Konduga Local Government Area of Borno. The News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) reports that the incident occurred on Friday at about 9:00 PM, when three suicide bombers detonated explosives at the Kasuwar Kifi in the outskirts of Konduga town. A witness said the three suicide bombers simultaneously detonated the Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) on their bodies in the crowded market.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram have reportedly ambushed a convoy of about 20 commercial vehicles travelling on a major highway in Borno State. The insurgents reportedly fired several shots on the convoy of commercial and private vehicles with military escorts at Yeleri, along Maiduguri-Damboa road. Sources said some of the passengers in one of the vehicles might have been kidnapped by the insurgents.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: A PDP leader is dead following an attack at a political rally in Nwofe.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 17 February. A PDP adherent is killed during a party political rally in Agbaja. Perpetrators not known. The attack led to a protest of the act on 19 February.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: A masquerade was allegedly killed by suspected gunmen at Inoziomi quarters in Adavi Local Government Area of Kogi State.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: The chairman of Always Petroleum and Gas, based in Okene, Kogi State, Alhaji Otinau Momoh Jimoh was reportedly kidnapped Sunday evening by unknown gunmen.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attacks a girl's school in Dapchi, abducts 110 students.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On February 19, presumed Boko Haram militants abducted three civilians, beat and released them in the area of Chetimari.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram militants killed five civilians and wounded five others in northern Cameroon after crossing the border from Nigeria.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa)
Summary: Presumed ISWAP militants killed two Chadian soldiers by ambush between the locality of Ngouboua and Nigerian border in the Lake Chad region.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: One dead and 150 houses burned in Vourkaza.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Property destruction: On 21 Feb 2018, Boko Karam/ISWAP fighters attacked Tchebe-Tchebe (Mayo Moskota). They burnt 40 houses.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 3 civilians were killed in Baljoel by Boko Haram.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 3 people killed in Kordo.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 5 civilians killed between Bourvare and Goumouldi. No further information.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: An APC leader is abducted in Nembe LGA on 24/02.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: The body of a woman is found outside a church. Motives, perpetrators not known.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On February 26, presumed Boko Haram militants severely wounded two civilians amidst an attempt to abduct a girl in Wouloua.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On February 26, presumed Boko Haram militants killed two civilians and abducted a girl in Tchingoa.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Following a clash with security detail, unidentified gunmen kidnap an area monarch in Ikot Edet.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: An official of the Federal Road Safety Corps, FRSC, was killed when suspected kidnappers abducted the wife and child of a reporter with the Voice of America, VOA.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attacks Miltu and Kaya villages, killing one and abducting three. The attackers also took a large quantity of food and other supplies.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Boko Haram attacks Miltu and Kaya villages, killing one and abducting three. The attackers also took a large quantity of food and other supplies.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: A suicide bomber in Buni Yadi, Yobe killed herself and injured three others when a bomb wrapped on her exploded in the early hours of Friday.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 03 March. An attack in Rann by Boko Haram have left three international aid workers dead and resulted in the abduction of three other aid workers.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 3 March. An armed group invaded the venue of an empowerment programme, organized by a PDP Senator. The group came into the building with weapons, attacking attendees. Extent of causalities not known.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 05 March. Boko Haram attacks and kills three loggers in Dikwa. The remainder of the logging party fled. The four remaining workers stepped on a Boko Haram landmine the following day.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 05 March. Boko Haram attacks Gudda village of Mafa Local Government Area, slitting the throats of two farmers.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 06 March. Boko Haram attacks and kills three civilians at Gamboru on 06/03.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 06 March. Following a Boko Haram attack on a group of loggers on 05/03, the remaining members of the group fled only to step on a Boko Haram land mine on 06/03. Four deaths.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Looting: Boko Haram incursion at Chepouri village in Kolofata. Several houses were looted.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
Summary: On March 9, villagers found the corpse of an individual killed by militants in the area of Foneko.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
Summary: On March 12, presumed ISGS militants aboard motorbikes attacked a gendarmerie checkpoint in Goube, about 35km north of the capital Niamey on the road towards Ouallam, three gendarmes were killed and one was wounded in the attack.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
Summary: On March 12, presumed ISGS militants attacked the National Guard camp in the village of Libiri, one gendarme was wounded in the attack and the camp burned.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 14 March. Two Boko Haram suicide bombers attack Alikaramanti village in Giwa Barracks of Maiduguri, killing themselves and injuring nine. Security operatives were able to stop the bombers before they were able to gain access to the area and potentially cause more damage.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 15 March, BH kidnapped the chief of the Charack village (between Makari and Hile Alifa).

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 17 March. Boko Haram attacked a group of fishermen on Tudun Umbrella island in Lake Chad. Five deaths reported.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 18 March. 3 persons were killed by Boko Haram. The victims were killed near an internally displaced persons camp in or near Maiduguri.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 19 March. A group of mercenaries reportedly working for herdsmen attack Agbenema, Omala LGA. Three reported dead.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 20 March, a man was killed and twenty cattle heads were seized by BH men in Mayo Holta, Mayo Tsanaga.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Agreement: 21 March. The Nigerian government has announced that Boko Haram has released 101 of the 110 abducted 'Dapchi schoolgirls' on 21/03. There are unconfirmed reports that 5 may have died while in Boko Haram custody.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa)
Summary: On 22 March, ISWAP militants attacked the village of Toumour and killed at least five civilians and wounded several others, the militants also seized large amounts of food.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Looting: On 23 March, BH men attacked (and presumably looted) Samana village, Bargaram. Herders had to flee.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 25 March, a woman was killed by Boko Haram men in Krawa-Mafa in Mayo Moskoto.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 25 March, two travellers were killed by Boko Haram men around Gassama, Logone and Chari.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 26 March. 3 female Boko Haram suicide bombers died during a failed suicide operation in Konduga LGA. They detonated the explosives on themselves and injured 3 others.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 26 March, the FMM post was attacked by Boko Haram in Fotokol. 2 soldiers dead, one missing and 3 wounded.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 28 March. Unknown gunmen stormed Akpan Esiet Market in Ukanafun LGA and killed 2 people.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 01 April. 29 are dead following a Boko Haram attack on Bale Galtimari, Bale-Shuwa, Bale-Kura and Alikaranti areas in Jere LGA. The attack was complex; Eighteen Boko Haram on foot attacked the military base while seven suicide bombers targeted residents of nearby Bale Shuwar and Alikaranti villages at 8:50 pm. The chief security officer at the State Emergency Management Agency initially claimed 18 dead, though that figure was raised to 20 after two wounded succumbed to injures. Among the counted dead were six foot soldiers and 7 suicide bombers. 84 others wounded.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 01 April. Two are dead and 9 abducted in an attack by unidentified perpetrators in Tsohuwar Gwari, Birnin Gwari LGA.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Looting: On 1 April, BH men seized 254 cattle heads and 193 sheeps in Matakaya, Amchide.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 2 April, a man was killed by BH men following an attack in Mogbere, Limani.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 2 April, BH elements attacked a military post in Sagme, Fotokol. 5 soldiers and 15 BH men dead; 3 soldiers wounded. The attacked soldiers were those who participated in the Gomaram operation.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 2 April, the Cameroonian army post in Amtalia, Waza, was attacked by BH men and kamikazes. 2 kamikazes dead and 1 soldier wounded.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 03 April. An unidentified armed group raids a police station, steal weapons and kill 2 policemen and another civilian in the station in Gegu of Koton Karfe (Kogi) LGA.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Property destruction: On 5 April, BH elements set fire to twenty houses in Zamga, Mayo Tsanaga.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 05 April. Unidentified gunmen attack Sarari village near Kuriga town. Ten shot, eight dead.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 07 April. At least five people were killed travelling on a road between Lafia and Makurdi at Yelwata. Perpetrators, motive for the attack not known, though Fulani have been known to be active in the area.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 8 April, Boko Haram men attacked the village of Alagarno (Kolofata) killing 2 people and injuring 2 others.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 08 April. Unidentified gunmen attacked Inding village in Barkin Ladi during the night-time hours. Five dead, three injured. The reason for the attack is not known. This Day claims 8 dead.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 9 April, Boko Haram elements kidnapped 2 truck drivers between Mada and Zigague.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 10 April. Unidentified gunmen dressed in military uniform (possibly Fulani, as the militia also attacked the area the following day) attacked Gbwer, is in Logo Local Area. Three deaths reported.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
Summary: On April 11, presumed ISGS militants abducted a German aid worker about 25km south of In-Ates. The vehicle he was travelling in together with his associates was set on fire.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 11 April, Boko Haram elements attacked Amichde: 2 people wounded.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 11 April. Unidentified gunmen attack Kuru-kuru mining site and Jarkuka village in Anka LGA. "Scores" killed; AFP claims 26 dead. The attacks displaced over 20 area communities.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 11 April. Unidentified gunmen reportedly abducted three persons at Nirowi forest along Old Ore-Lagos toll gate in Odigbo Local Government Area of Ondo State.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 04 December. IS-aligned Boko Haram members clashed with military forces in Gudumbali. Two soldiers were injured.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 12 April. Unidentified perpetrators kill two police and abduct 22, including a NURTW chair in Birnin Gwari.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 14-15 April. A leader of the PDP is stabbed to death during a political meeting in Maiduguri "at the weekend."

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 15 April. Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a member of NURTW in Akure North LGA, exact location not given.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
Summary: On April 16, two presumed ISGS militants killed a merchant in the village of Rounfou, villagers who pursued the assailants while awaiting security forces were ambushed a few kilometers from the village of Margou, seven young men were killed, stripped of their belongings and had their motorbikes burned.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 16 April, 2 fishermen were killed by Boko Haram in Ngame, Waza.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 16 April. Unidentified kidnappers abduct two members of government staff in Ifira Akoko, Akoko South East. It is not known if the attack is related to the abduction of an NURTW members the previous day.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 16 April. Four persons have been killed by unknown gunmen at Sabon Gida in Donga LGA. Another was killed in nearby Tunari.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 16 April. Four persons have been killed by unknown gunmen at Sabon Gida in Donga LGA. Another was killed in nearby Tunari.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 16 April. Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a German construction worker and killed a police escort in Kano.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 17 April. Unidentified gunmen abduct the Speaker of the Benue House in Manor village, Ikyov council ward of Ushongo LGA.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 18 April, Boko Haram men attacked Zalala, Zigague and seized a cattle herd. One wounded.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 18 April. Unidentified persons attack residents of Ogbakiri, killing a pregnant woman and three others. The attackers cut open the mother's womb and took the baby. It is not known if the child survived.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Looting: On 21 April, Boko Haram men looted and burned down Matakaya village, Amchide. BIR intervention later allowed to recover the cattle stolen.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Agreement: 21 April. Two Boko Haram commanders (as well as others) surrendered to government forces in Maiduguri. The names of the commanders were not given.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 21 April, on or about. Six are killed by unidentified attackers at an APC meeting at an unknown location in Benue State. Date vague; possible occurred over the weekend of the 20-22 April.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 22 April. Two Boko Haram suicide bombers between the ages of 13 to 14 years and two worshippers lost their lives when the bombers invaded a mosque around Bama Dina ward of Bama. There were many other injuries. The attack occurred during the early morning hours. The Sun reports 12 dead.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 22 April. Boko Haram attack and kills 18 wood collectors near Gamboru.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 22 April. 16 are dead following an attack from unidentified "hoodlums" on Kpanche, Ozugbe and Biroko communities of Bassa LGA. Additionally, several structures were destroyed.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: On 28 April 2018, "bandits" attacked Janruwa community in Birnin-Gwari local government area of Kaduna State, killing between 8 and 14 local miners according to two sources, while several others sustained serious injuries.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 29 April, Boko Haram men attacked Bia, Kolofata: 1 dead and cattle seized.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 29 April, Boko Haram men attacked Blabline, Kolofata: 1 dead and cattle seized.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On April 29, presumed Boko Haram (ISWA) members attacked a Nigerien army position between Ngagam and Garin Wanzam, three soldiers were killed in the attack and several vehicles seized by the assailants.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 29 April. Gunmen kill two in Makurdi. The victims are believed to be Tiv. Perpetrators not known.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Looting: On 30 April, Boko Haram elements attacked Benesoue locality, Fotokol, seizing several cattle heads. They planted landmines to cover their retreat.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 30 April, Boko Haram elements attacked Amchide, Kolofata: 1 dead.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: Around 1 May, the village chief of Kalama, Makary was kidnapped by Boko Haram. He was freed on 6 May after a ransom was paid.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 1 May, a truck was hit by a landmine planted by Boko Haram men in Madina, Makari. Severe material damages but no physical harm.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 01 May. The Daily Trust reports twin suicide bombers which killed 27 and injured 64 in Mubi. This Day reports 60 dead; the Sun, 68. However, in a report published the following will the causality figure stood at "more than 20." The first explosion occurred in a mosque, while a second occurred in a market. Perpetrators believed to be Boko Haram. It is not known if the perpetrators were present at the time of detonation.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 01 May. Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill an aid to PDP Governor Seriake Dickson of Bayelsa State in Kolokuma/Opokuma LGA.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 2 May, groups of BH fighters attacked Mabanda village, close to the Sambisa forest, executing some villagers accused of failing to inform BH when Cameroon army arrived. The intervention of the Cameroonian army prompted BH men to retreat after some clashes. 14 civilians were executed, and 7 BH men killed when the army intervened. Dozens were wounded.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 2 May, groups of BH fighters attacked Mabanda village, close to the Sambisa forest, executing some villagers accused of failing to inform BH when Cameroon army arrived. The intervention of the Cameroonian army prompted BH men to retreat after some clashes. 14 civilians were executed, and 7 BH men killed when the army intervened. Dozens were wounded.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 3 May, a man was killed during a Boko Haram incursion in Tcherive, Mayo-Sava. 20 huts burned.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 03 May, on or about. Five are dead following an attack on two communities in Donga LGA by unidentified militia. Precise date of the attack is not known.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 04 May. Four Boko Haram suicide bombers attack Mainari Kanuri and Shua villages killing themselves and three others.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 04 May. The APC Owerri Imo state Deputy governor is attacked at the party's state secretariat. The violence was broken up before injury was reported. Perpetrators not known.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 5 May, a man was killed at his field in Krawamafa by Boko Haram men.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 05 May. An APC ward Chairmanship aspirant, Mr. Jeremiah Oghoveta, Ward 10, Otu-Jeremi, Ughelli South local government area, Delta State was reportedly killed by unknown gunmen during an APC party Congress in Oshimili South.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Property destruction: 05 May. Unidentified "hoodlums" burnt part of the APC Ningi Local Government Area secretariat.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: Property destruction: 06 May. "Armed hoodlums" attack the home of the District Head of Gashish in Riyom Local Government Area. Reports of property destruction.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On 7 May, a man was killed by Boko Haram men in Krawa, Mayo-Tsanaga.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa)
Summary: On or around 9 May 2018, Boko Haram soldiers attacked the Nigerian army barracks near the village of Shitmari (most likely in Borno state) and seized weapons, ammunitions, and military equipments.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 09 May. Boko Haram attacks Kongulon Village in Konduga and killed 2 people.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: On 09 May 2018, unidentified gunmen attack Tutuwa community in Ussa LGA. Nine deaths reported.

Summary: 10 November. Boko Haram attacked Jimmi (no coordinates available), a town 5 km from Maiduguri. The attackers fired their weapons and set homes and tents from an informal IDP camp on fire.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 11 November. Military forces killed one member of Boko Haram and captured another in Mozogo.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 13 November. Two Boko Haram members on a motorcycle fired on farmers in Gremari, killing one.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 14 November. Boko Haram attacked Mammanti, a town next to Maiduguri. One person was killed. The attackers burned down homes and looted supplies from the village.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa)

Soldiers were initially forced to retreat but air support and additional ground troops were able to push the attackers back. Three soldiers were killed and some others were injured. Weapons and military equipments were also seized.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 15 November. Boko Haram abducted 10 female IDPs in the outskirts of Maiduguri.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: On November 16, in Gogo village (Mayo-Sava, Extreme Nord), Boko Haram militants attacked the village, injured five people, burned huts, and stole three motorcycles.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 16 November. Boko Haram attacked a military base in Kekeno. The groups clashed for three hours but with the help from reinforcements the military was able to repel the attackers. One fatality was reported.

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)

Perpetrator: Islamic State (Greater Sahara)

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS
Summary: 17 November. IS-aligned Boko Haram members attacked a military base in Mainok, killing one soldier.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS

However, a soldier reported as many as 70 casualties and indicated that the efforts to evacuate the bodies have failed due to the insurgents continued presence in the area.

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS

Perpetrator: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - JAS

Perpetrator: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
Summary: 20 October 2019. After the local militias was defeated by the unidentified gunmen that were occasionally attacking the people in various villages of Kaduna state, the unidentified gunmen (that the villagers call as Bandits) attacked the civilians in sixteen villages, causing the displacement of 2000 people. Tura, Unguwan Gebi, Unguwan Dangauta, Unguwan Nayawu, Sabon Gida, Unguwan Alhaji Ahmadu, Kusau, Unguwan Pati, Unguwan Tofa, Sauran Giwa, Unguwan Makeri, Gigane, Dallatu, Sabon Gari, Gidan Sarkin Noma were the villages known to have been attacked. One event coded for the each found village and one event coded in Kaduna state center with GP3 for the unfound villages. Seven events in total. Five civilians were killed in the attacks, dispersed across seven events (1).
